page.title: 20DUNSBURY HILL FARM
page.content: Dunsbury Hill Farm was probably built about 1830 because a brick on a wall of an outhouse records this as 1839 but the outhouse could have been a later extention. The hill itself was mentioned in the Domesday Book. The farm covers 200 acres but 20 acres were lost when the M3 Motorway was built. The farm is made up of ten major buildings the house and other various store's. No crops are grown and the grass is used for grazing and for hay mayking. The main part of the live stock is the cattle but chickens and ducks are also raised probably only for fresh eggs. The cows (there are 150 to 200 of them atany one time)are taken to market 4 or 5 perday during two 4 week periods in July and December.Each cow can fetch up to Â£500 .
